* The main class of the Joko task manager application.

*

This class handles the user interface, task storage, and command parsing.
* It runs the main program loop where users can add, list, mark/unmark, find
* The entry point of the Joko application.

*

It initializes the user interface and storage, loads tasks, and
* enters a loop to process user commands until the "bye" command is received.
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
ui.showMessage("Please type a valid input: <mark/unmark> <task number>");
ui.showMessage("Please type a valid input: <delete> <task number>");
ui.showMessage("Sorry, I could not understand your command :(");

* Controller for the main GUI of the Joko application.
* This class manages the interaction between the user and the Joko logic,
* displaying dialog boxes in the GUI for both user input and Joko's responses.

* value to the height of the dialog container so that it scrolls automatically.
* Injects a {@link GuiJoko} instance into the controller.
* Also adds Joko's welcome message to the dialog container when the instance is set.
* @param j the {@code GuiJoko} instance to set

* Parses user input into commands for the Joko task manager application.

* @param to   the end time (for Event tasks)
